author: The Associated Press
title: NFL Today, Week 5
text:
By The Associated Press - Associated Press - Sunday, October 11, 2015 
SCOREBOARD 
Monday, Oct. 12 
Pittsburgh (2-2) at San Diego (2-2), 8:30 p.m. Minus QB Ben Roethlisberger - Mike Vick starts - the Steelers might need to recharge their passing game to keep up with the Chargers. San Diego ranks second in passing and gets back TE Antonio Gates from a four-game suspension. 
___ 
STARS 
Passing 
-Josh McCown, Browns, was 36 for 51 for 457 yards and two touchdown passes in Cleveland’s 33-30 overtime win over Baltimore. He is the first Browns quarterback with three straight 300-yard games and broke the team record of 444 yards passing set by Brian Sipe on Oct. 25, 1981, against the Baltimore Colts. 
-Andy Dalton, Bengals, was 30 for 44 for 331 yards and two touchdown passes and an interception in Cincinnati’s 27-24 overtime win over Seattle. 
-Tom Brady, Patriots, was 20 for 27 for 275 yards and two touchdown passes in New England’s 30-6 win over Dallas. Brady, in his 16th season, joined Peyton Manning and Fran Tarkenton as the only NFL quarterbacks with 4-0 starts at least four times. 
-Blake Bortles, Jaguars, was 23 for 33 for 303 yards and four touchdown passes and an interception in Jacksonville’s 38-31 loss to Tampa Bay. 
-Jay Cutler, Bears, was 26 for 45 for 252 yards and two touchdown passes in Chicago’s 18-17 win over Kansas City. 
___ 
Rushing 
-Thomas Rawls, Seahawks, had 23 carries for 169 yards, including a 69-yard touchdown in Seattle’s 27-24 overtime loss to Cincinnati. 
-Todd Gurley, Rams, had 30 carries for 159 yards in St. Louis’ 24-10 loss to Green Bay.
